intro: Solanum herba-bona, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by berries that mature to a dark purple color. The plant contains various alkaloids and is used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
